instruction: What kinds of spectral indices were used to estimate chlorophyll-a (chl-a) content in the Menor sea, a coastal lagoon?
Output: The related study used remote sensing spectrum to estimate chlorophyll-a (chl-a) content in the Menor sea, a coastal lagoon.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used to estimate chlorophyll-a (chl-a) content in the Menor sea, a coastal lagoon?
Output: The spectral feature processing methods used to estimate chlorophyll-a (chl-a) content in the Menor sea were the generation of two ratios: B3/B8 and B3/B8A using the S2 bands covering the green and NIR parts of the spectrum.

instruction: What metric was chosen to estimate chlorophyll-a (chl-a) content in the Menor sea, a coastal lagoon and how far can this metric go?
Output: The metric chosen to estimate chlorophyll-a (chl-a) content in the Menor sea was the ratio B3/B8. This metric can go as far as estimating water quality parameters and is very sensitive to estimating chl-a concentrations.

instruction: What feature selection scenarios were considered in the machine learning approach to estimate chlorophyll-a content using Sentinel-2 data in the Menor sea?
Output: Three feature selection scenarios were considered in the machine learning approach to estimate chlorophyll-a content using Sentinel-2 data in the Menor sea.

instruction: How do the performance results of the machine learning algorithms using all available predictors compare to those using principal components in estimating chl-a concentration in the Menor sea using Sentinel-2 data?
Output: The performance results of the machine learning algorithms using all available predictors (Random Forest, Support Vector Machine, and Deep Neural Network) in estimating chl-a concentration in the Menor sea using Sentinel-2 data were better compared to those using principal components. The Root Mean Square Error (RMSE) for Random Forest and Support Vector Machine algorithms using all predictors was 0.82 mg/m3, while the RMSE for Deep Neural Network was 1.76 mg/m3. On the other hand, the Artificial Neural Network algorithm achieved better results when using principal components.
